page.title: 14Religion.
page.content: There are places of worship in the town for a good many different sects.Primarily the town has four Anglican churches and two Roman Catholic. Some others are Methodist,United Reformed,Baptist and Plymouth Brethren. The congregations appear to be enlarging again afterva somewhatblean period.There are church schools for the two main denominations.The churches are playing an increasing part in the social welfare,particularly of the older folk. The Bishop of Portsmouth has by tradition lived in Fareham and has given his title to that area of the town,'Bishopfield'.
